verses.text: 在烏西雅、約坦、亞哈斯和希西家作猶大王的時候，亞摩斯的兒子以賽亞看見異象，是關於猶大和耶路撒冷的：

words.note: Refers to the Kingdom of Judah.

words.definition: to see, to catch sight of

words.note: Often refers to a divine or prophetic vision in religious contexts.

verses.heading: Heading

verses.text: 諸天哪！要聽。大地啊！要留心聽。因為耶和華說：「我把孩子養育，使他們成長，他們卻背叛了我。

words.note: Formal or archaic way to refer to 'all heavens'.
Literally 'to leave one's heart/mind'.

verses.heading: Obedience, not Sacrifice

verses.text: 牛認識主人，驢認識主人的槽；以色列卻不認識我，我的子民不明白我。」

words.note: Refers to the people of Israel.
Literally 'clear white', meaning 'understand clearly'.

verses.text: 嗐！犯罪的國，罪孽深重的子民，行惡的子孫，敗壞的兒女！他們離棄了耶和華，藐視以色列的聖者，他們轉離了他。

words.note: Often used in a religious context for 'to sin'.
A stronger term for sin than just 罪.
Often used in a spiritual context for turning away from God.

verses.text: 你們為甚麼屢次悖逆，還要受責打嗎？你們整個頭都受了傷，整個心都發昏了。

words.note: More formal/stronger than everyday 'disobedient'.
Here refers to divine punishment or severe discipline.
Here implies spiritual sickness or weakness.

verses.text: 從腳掌到頭頂，沒有一處是完全的；盡是創傷、鞭痕和流血的傷口；沒有擠乾淨傷口，沒有包紮，也沒有用膏油滋潤。

words.note: Refers to medicinal or anointing oil.

verses.text: 你們的土地荒涼，你們的城鎮被火燒毀，你們的田地，在你們面前給外族人侵吞；被外族人傾覆之後，就荒涼了。

words.note: Similar to 被, indicates passive voice.
Often refers to non-Israelite peoples in biblical context.

verses.text: 僅存的錫安居民（「居民」原文作「女子」），好像葡萄園中的草棚，瓜田裡的茅屋，被圍困的城鎮。
若不是萬軍之耶和華給我們留下一些生還者，我們早已像所多瑪、蛾摩拉一樣了。

words.note: A title for God emphasizing his sovereignty over heavenly armies.

verses.text: ，一面犯罪你們這些所多瑪的官長啊！要聽耶和華的話；你們這些蛾摩拉的人民啊！要側耳聽我們 神的教訓。

words.definition: one side, at the same time

words.note: A classical way to express listening intently.
In Chinese Bibles, an empty space often precedes '神' as a sign of reverence.

verses.text: 耶和華說：「你們獻上眾多祭物，對我有甚麼益處呢？公綿羊的燔祭和肥畜的脂肪，我已經夠了；公牛、羊羔和公山羊的血，我都不喜悅。

words.note: 上 acts as a directional complement, indicating 'up' or 'forth'.
A formal or literary term for 'be happy' or 'be pleased'.

verses.text: 你們來朝見我的時候，誰要求你們這樣踐踏我的院子呢？

words.note: Refers to appearing before an emperor or deity, often with reverence.

verses.text: 不要再帶沒有意義的供物來了，燒獻祭物的香氣也是我厭惡的。我厭煩月朔、安息日和集會；作罪孽又守嚴肅會，是我不能容忍的。

words.note: Verb with 'le' particle, indicating completion or change of state.

words.definition: be weary of, fed up with

words.note: Lit. 'peace and rest day'.

verses.text: 你們的月朔和制定的節期，我心裡恨惡；它們都成了我的重擔，我已承擔得不耐煩了。

words.note: Indicates result or degree after a verb.
Indicates change of state or new situation.

verses.text: 所以你們張開雙手的時候，我必掩眼不看你們；即使你們多多禱告，我也不聽；你們的手都沾滿血腥。

words.note: A more literary or biblical term for covering one's eyes.
Repetition emphasizes degree: 'many many' or 'very much'.

verses.text: 你們要洗滌自己，潔淨自己；從我眼前除掉你們的惡行；要停止作惡，

words.note: Formal term for washing or cleansing.
Often used in religious or ritualistic contexts.
Verb-complement construction indicating removal.
Verb-object compound, 'commit evil acts'.

verses.text: 學習行善，尋求公平，指責殘暴的人，替孤兒伸冤，為寡婦辨屈。」

words.note: Verb-object compound, 'practice good'.
Verb-object compound, 'vindicate a wrong'.
Verb-object compound, 'explain a grievance'.

verses.text: 耶和華說：「你們來，我們彼此辯論；你們的罪雖像硃紅，必變成雪白；雖紅如丹顏，必白如羊毛。

words.note: In a religious context, refers to sin against God.
A deep, vivid red, historically associated with luxury and sin.
A vivid red, often poetic; referring to the color of cinnabar.

verses.text: 你們若願意聽從，就必得吃地上的美物；

words.note: Here, 'get to' or 'be able to'.
Often refers to blessings or bountiful harvests in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 你們若不聽從，反而悖逆，就必被刀劍吞滅。」這是耶和華親口說的。

words.note: Strong term for disobedience or rebellion, especially against authority or divine will.
Often implies utter destruction or overwhelming defeat in biblical texts.
Indicates a declarative statement or emphasizes the preceding clause.

verses.text: 那忠貞的城，怎麼會變成妓女！她從前充滿公平，有公義居在其中，現在卻有兇手居住。

words.note: Figuratively, a city that has become unfaithful to God.

verses.heading: Purifying Judgment

verses.text: 你的銀子變成了渣滓，你的酒用水攙混。

words.note: Indicates a completed action or change of state.
Impurities removed during refining; often used figuratively for moral corruption.

verses.text: 你的官長存心悖逆，與盜賊同夥；人都貪愛賄賂，追索私酬；他們不替孤兒伸冤，寡婦的案件也呈不到他們面前。

words.note: Implies a deliberate, often negative, intention.
More formal than 'gēn' (跟).
A potential complement 'bu dao' indicating inability to achieve the action.

verses.text: 因此，主萬軍之耶和華，以色列的大能者說：「哎！我要向我的對頭雪恨，向我的仇敵報復。

words.note: A title for God or Christ.
Part of the title 'Lord of Hosts' (萬軍之耶和華).
Classical Chinese particle, often equivalent to 'de' (的).
The Hebrew name for God.
A descriptive title for God.
An exclamation of sorrow, regret, or warning.
Lit. 'to wash away hatred like snow'.

verses.text: 我必把手轉過來攻擊你；我要煉除你的渣滓，如同用鹼來煉一樣，我要除去你的一切雜質。

words.note: Implies a strong certainty or necessity.
Used to place the object before the verb, emphasizing its disposal.
Combines refining (like metal) with removing impurities.
Impurities removed during refining; often used figuratively for moral corruption.

verses.text: 我必恢復你的審判官，像起初一樣；也必恢復你的謀士，像起先一般；以後，你必稱為公義的城、忠貞的城。」

words.note: Refers to a judicial official.
Often used in Genesis for 'in the beginning'.

verses.text: 錫安必因公平蒙救贖，城中悔改的人也必因公義蒙救贖。

words.note: Often implies receiving something from a higher power, often blessings or misfortune.

verses.text: 但悖逆的和犯罪的，必一同滅亡，離棄耶和華的，也必滅亡。

words.note: Describes behavior against authority or morality.

verses.text: 你們必因你們所喜愛的橡樹抱愧，必因你們所選擇的園子蒙羞。

words.note: Indicates a passive or emphasizes the object of a verb.
Often associated with pagan worship in the Old Testament.
Similar to '抱愧' but often implying public disgrace.

verses.text: 因為你們必像一棵葉子凋落的橡樹，又如一個缺水的園子。

words.note: Describes plants losing vitality and leaves.

verses.text: 有權勢的必如麻絮，他所作的好像火星；都要一同焚毀，沒有人能撲滅。

words.note: Refers to easily combustible material, like dry flax fibers.
Forms passive or nominalizes a verb phrase.
